metadata.topic_title: Prohibition Against Double Billing and Bribery

hierarchy.subdomain: Professional Ethics and Codes of Conduct

active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a cybersecurity supply chain context, debate how bribery in vendor selection (e.g., overlooking weak security for kickbacks) creates amplified cyber risks. Support your position with OECD Convention principles and real-world examples like the SolarWinds breach influenced by poor vendor ethics.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity ethics education. Generate 20 high-quality flashcards on 'Prohibition Against Double Billing and Bribery' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Professional Ethics and Codes of Conduct > Foundational Ethical Principles > Professional Integrity and Honesty > Prohibition Against Double Billing and Bribery). Incorporate: - Learning objectives: [insert full list from above] - Active learning: Tie explanations to discussion/peer teaching/problem-solving. - Scaffolding: Distribute cards across 4 layers [insert summaries]. - Big picture: Ethics reduce financial risks amplifying cyber vulns. - Sources: NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5 (https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/53/r5/upd1/final), OECD Convention (https://www.oecd.org/corruption/oecdantibriberyconvention.htm), ISO 37301. Use exact flashcard schema: JSON array of objects with 'front', 'back' {answer, explanation, references, scaffolding_layer, bloom_level}. Follow distractor protocol for MCQs. Ensure progressive complexity, real-world examples (supply chain bribery, MSSP double billing), and voter consensus (85.7% approval). Output only valid JSON array of 20 flashcards.
